meanings.definition: The quality or state of being acceptable.
meanings.sent1: The acceptability of the new policy was questioned by many employees.
meanings.sent2: The teacher explained the importance of acceptability in a group project.
meanings.sent3: The acceptability of wearing pajamas to work was a topic of discussion at the office.
meanings.sent4: Her artwork pushed the boundaries of acceptability in the art world.
meanings.sent5: The acceptability of his behavior was crystal clear to everyone in the room.

meanings.definition: The ability to be accepted or tolerated.
meanings.sent1: The team discussed the acceptability of the proposed changes.
meanings.sent2: In a diverse society, understanding cultural acceptability is crucial.
meanings.sent3: The acceptability of eating ice cream for breakfast made the children giggle.
meanings.sent4: His speech had a level of acceptability that resonated with the audience.
meanings.sent5: The acceptability of her decision was met with a round of applause.
